intro: Licaria conoidea, commonly known as the cone-shaped licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique cone-shaped inflorescence, which consists of numerous small, five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Licaria conoidea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
